episodes.title: Cult Leader Joseph Jeffers’ Final Years | Fraud, Abuse & Scandal
episodes.description:
Cult leader Joseph Jeffers spent decades leaving behind a trail of fraud, violence, and abuse. After moving his Kingdom Temple to St. James, Missouri in 1974, Jeffers convinced followers that Jesus would return in a UFO to take them away. But behind the strange teachings was a darker reality.

By 1979, Jeffers was arrested for hiring a hitman to kill his wife Connie. He also conned an elderly widow out of a $5 million estate and was accused of assaulting a 14-year-old girl. Newspapers soon reported that Jeffers claimed “God told him to leave Missouri.”

The final years of his life were just as bizarre. From Bermuda to Australia, he tried pushing his twisted beliefs but was quickly rejected. Despite allegations of fraud, grooming, and sexual assault, Jeffers escaped real accountability.

In 1988, just a month before turning 90, Joseph Jeffers died of natural causes—never truly facing justice for the lives he harmed.

📌 Watch now as we uncover the outrageous final years of Joseph Jeffers and the shocking crimes that went largely unpunished.

episodes.title: Murder in Denver: The Strange Death of Cult Leader's Wife Helen Vea Borg
episodes.description:
In March 1957, Denver was shaken by the shocking and mysterious death of Helen Vea Borg, estranged wife of controversial mystic Joseph Jeffers. After surviving a brutal late-night attack in her office, Helen was released from the hospital—only to be found dead just two days later under suspicious circumstances.

Was her death caused by a head injury? A mysterious morphine derivative in her system? Or was something more sinister at play? Some believe Helen’s controlling husband had both the motive and the means to benefit from her untimely death.

In this video, we dive deep into:
✔️ The brutal attack inside the McClintock Building
✔️ Conflicting witness descriptions of the assailant
✔️ The suspicious timing of Helen’s death
✔️ Joseph Jeffers’ inheritance motive
✔️ Why this case vanished from Denver’s cold case archives

This unsolved true crime case is one of Denver’s most disturbing forgotten mysteries.

episodes.title: The Preacher Who Rocked Los Angeles: Joseph Jeffers’ Scandalous 1939 Trial
episodes.description:
In the late 1930s, preacher Joseph Davis Jeffers was one of the most controversial religious leaders in America. From riots in Arkansas to fiery sermons in Los Angeles, Jeffers built a following with his Kingdom of Yahweh movement — but his fame came crashing down when he and his wife, Zella Joy Wood, were caught in one of the most shocking scandals of the decade.

Arrested on felonious moral charges, Jeffers stood trial in a courtroom circus filled with confessions, outrageous accusations, and sensational headlines like:
📰 “Pro-Nazi Leader Jailed for Orgy in Home at L.A.”
📰 “Orgy Trial of Minister Opens”

Despite the evidence, Jeffers and Zella walked free — celebrated by hundreds of loyal followers waving Bibles in support.

In this video, we dive deep into:
- The rise of Joseph Jeffers and the Kingdom of Yahweh
- His honeymoon claims of meeting Mussolini and the Nazi spy investigation
- The undercover sting operation that led to his arrest
- The wild courtroom drama and shocking testimony
- How Jeffers turned scandal into power

This is a story of religion, scandal, and survival in 1930s Los Angeles — and why the case of Joseph Jeffers still fascinates true crime and history lovers today.
